subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. SIF = 4B-N-(4–5)-2110.0000; fPp = B/B/BBB; fCx = 1.1.1; fSt = 2.2; fSc: PL> AM> AL; Ip = 680–736; fD = 4H-(10–14)-(8–10)-(8–10)-6-…; DS = 37–46; VS = 30–39; NDV = 73–78. Standard measurements of specimens from Turkey are given in Table 29 .

caption.paragraph:
TABLE 29. Standard measurements of
Cheladonta flava
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Note: For S n = 1, for other variables n = 3.

Type material (not examined).
Syntypes are deposited in ZMMU. Type locality is Kantemir railroad station ( 46° 07' N , 30° 06' E ) in Ukraine ( Odessa Prov. , Bilhorod-Dnistrovskyi Distr. )
.

Material from Turkey examined.
2 larvae (ZISP) ex
Chionomys nivalis
, Antalya Prov. , 6 km SWW from Kizlarsivrisi Mt ,
2135 m a.s.l.
,
26 April 2009
, coll. AAS
;
1 larva (ZISP) ex
Microtus schidlovskii
, Adana Prov. , 2 km N from Karanfil Mt ,
2135 m a.s.l.
,
2 May 2009
, coll. AAS
;
7 larvae (ZISP) ex
M. schidlovskii
, Mersin Prov. , 12 km NW from Çamlıyayla (Namrun),
2467 m a.s.l.
,
11 May 2009
, coll. AAS
.

Hosts.
Lepus europaeus Pallas
,
Spermophilus suslicus (Guldenstaedt)
,
S. citellus
(L.),
S. pygmaeus (Pallas)
,
Spalax microphthalmus Guldenstaedt
,
Ellobius talpinus (Pallas)
,
Cricetus cricetus
(L.),
Cricetulus migratorius (Pallas)
,
Microtus socialis (Pallas)
,
M. arvalis (Pallas)
,
Rattus norvegicus (Berkenhout)
,
Apodemus sylvaticus
(L.),
A. flavicollis (Melchior)
, and
Sturnus vulgaris
L. ( Kudryashova 1998 ) plus
Chionomys nivalis (Martins)
and
Microtus schidlovskii Argyropulo.

Distribution. Ukraine , Moldova , Russia (Stavropolskiy Krai). Kudryashova (1998) questioned records of
Ch. flava
in Azerbaijan , Tadjikistan , and Buryatia. This species is here recorded from Turkey for the first time.
